sect2.title: Introduction to libpng
sect2.para: The libpng package contains libraries used by other programs for reading and writing PNG files.

listitem.para: Required Patch to explicitly link libpng against system libraries:

sect2.title: Installation of libpng
sect2.para: Install libpng by running the following commands:

userinput.command: patch -Np1 -i ../libpng-&libpng-version;-link_to_proper_libs-1.patch && make prefix=/usr ZLIBINC=/usr/include \ ZLIBLIB=/usr/lib -f scripts/makefile.linux && make prefix=/usr install -f scripts/makefile.linux

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: ZLIBINC=/usr/include ZLIBLIB=/usr/lib: This forces libpng to look for the zlib includes and libraries where they are installed.
-f scripts/makefile.linux: This points make at the Linux version of the Makefile as libpng doesn't use an autoconf routine. Instead it has various Makefiles for different platforms.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The libpng package contains libpng libraries and libpng-config.

sect3.title: libpng libraries
sect3.para: The libpng libraries are a collection of routines used to create and manipulate PNG format graphics files. The PNG format was designed as a replacement for GIF and, to a lesser extent, TIFF, with many improvements and extensions and lack of patent problems.

sect3.title: libpng-config
sect3.para: libpng-config provides configuration info for libpng.
